pullRequest.title: Added Capitalized
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added EO version of StringUtils.capitalize
I hope for your understanding, this is my first pull request to open source project.
Signed-off-by: kokodyn kokodyn@gmail.com

commit.message:
Added Capitalized

Added EO version of StringUtils.capitalize

Signed-off-by: kokodyn <kokodyn@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: @kokodyn Let's remove mutable variable from here. I guess Ternary can be used

commit.message:
#1465: changed Upper to Character.toTitleCase and other fixes

Signed-off-by: kokodyn <kokodyn@gmail.com>

+package org.cactoos.text;

+import org.cactoos.scalar.Ternary;
+
+/**
+ * Text in capitalized case,
+ * changed the first character to title case as per {@link Character#toTitleCase(int)},
+ * no other characters are changed.
+ *
+ * @since 0.46
+ */
+public final class Capitalized extends TextEnvelope {
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.

+     * @param text The text
+     */

+        this(new TextOf(text));
+    }
+

+     * Ctor.
+     *
+     * @param text The text
+     */
+    public Capitalized(final Text text) {
+        super(
+            new TextOf(
+                () -> {
+                    final Func<Text, Text> capitalize = cap -> {
+                        final Text titled = new TextOf(
+                            Character.toChars(
+                                Character.toTitleCase(
+                                    cap.asString().codePointAt(0)
+                                    )
+                                )
+                            );
+                        return
+                            new Ternary<Text>(

+ * SOFTWARE.

+package org.cactoos.text;
+
+import org.cactoos.Func;
+import org.cactoos.Text;
+import org.cactoos.scalar.Ternary;
+
+/**
+ * Text in capitalized case,
+ * changed the first character to title case as per {@link Character#toTitleCase(int)},
+ * no other characters are changed.
+ *
+ * @since 0.46
+ */
+public final class Capitalized extends TextEnvelope {
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.
+     *
+     * @param text The text
+     */
+    public Capitalized(final String text) {
+        this(new TextOf(text));
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.
+     *
+     * @param text The text
+     */
+    public Capitalized(final Text text) {
+        super(
+            new TextOf(
+                () -> {
+                    final Func<Text, Text> capitalize = cap -> {
+                        final Text titled = new TextOf(
+                            Character.toChars(
+                                Character.toTitleCase(
+                                    cap.asString().codePointAt(0)
+                                    )
+                                )
+                            );
+                        return
+                            new Ternary<Text>(
+                                () -> new StartsWith(cap, titled).value(),
+                                () -> cap,
+                                () -> new TextOf(new StringBuilder()
+                                    .append(titled.asString())
+                                    .append(new Sub(text, 1))
+                                    .toString()
+                                    )

commit.message:
#1465: add using Joined and other simplifications

Signed-off-by: kokodyn <kokodyn@gmail.com>

simplify logic and use upper

Signed-off-by: kokodyn <kokodyn@gmail.com>

add TODO comment to replace using Character#toTitleCase(int) in future

Signed-off-by: kokodyn <kokodyn@gmail.com>

+/**
+ * Text in capitalized case,
+ * changed the first character to title case as per {@link Character#toTitleCase(int)},
+ * no other characters are changed.
+ *
+ * @since 0.46
+ */
+public final class Capitalized extends TextEnvelope {
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.
+     *
+     * @param text The text
+     */
+    public Capitalized(final String text) {
+        this(new TextOf(text));
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.
+     * @param text The text
+     */
+    public Capitalized(final Text text) {
+        super(
+            new TextOf(
+                () -> {
+                    return new Ternary<Text>(
+                        new IsBlank(text),
+                        () -> text,
+                        () -> new Joined(
+                            "",
+                            new TextOf(
+                                Character.toChars(
+                                    Character.toTitleCase(
+                                        text.asString().codePointAt(0)
+                                    )
+                                )
+                            ),
+                            new Sub(text, 1)
+                            )
